title: Genesis Prize Marks Tenth Anniversary by Honoring Barbra Streisand
message:
10th Anniversary Genesis Prize Laureate Barbra Streisand receives a glass sculpture of a shofar from Genesis Prize Foundation co-founder Stan Polovets.
(Photo by Kevin Mazur/Getty Images for Genesis Prize Foundation)The Genesis Prize was established in 2014 when New York City Mayor, businessman and philanthropist Michael R. Bloomberg was announced as its inaugural laureate.
Barbra Streisand stated: "I am delighted to be honored by the special 10th Anniversary Genesis Prize and to work with The Genesis Prize Foundation to support organizations that acknowledge our shared humanity and seek to better our society.
She founded the Barbra Streisand Women's Heart Center at Cedars-Sinai to support research and raise awareness about women's heart disease.
About The Genesis Prize FoundationThe Genesis Prize is a global award that celebrates Jewish achievement and contribution to humanity.

event_breakdown:
1. In East Brunswick, New Jersey, antisemitic symbols and hate speech were discovered in a high school yearbook.
2. The incident has been reported on by a number of media outlets, including the New York Times and the New Jersey Globe.
3. The school's administration has ordered the yearbook to be removed from circulation until the issue is resolved.
4. The incident has sparked protests and calls for an investigation from the East Brunswick community.
5. The school's principal has spoken out against the incident, stating that the school does not tolerate such behavior.
6. The incident brings to the forefront the ongoing need for leadership within the school and community to promote inclusivity and respect for diversity.

title: Time to show some solidarity : Why Toronto mayor should attend this weekend Walk with Israel
message:
The mayor, Olivia Chow, should walk alongside them.
That sent a terrible message to Toronto Jews, many of whom have deep connections to Israel.
The Walk with Israel is an annual event intended to express backing for the Jewish state and celebrate the strength of the Jewish community.
Doing so would illustrate, more powerfully than any statement or speech, that she understands what Toronto Jews are enduring.
That is just what the Walk with Israel is meant to be.
